content.raw:
I was using orange because that was decided over a year ago in an internal email (search for "Gazebo style guide") and eventually became @spaepcke 's [style guide](https://drive.google.com/a/osrfoundation.org/uc?id=0B_0d9M9XDFBVa2RiMnJFYnRVWUk&export=download).

The long term goal is to eventually support some / all of the [material design color palettes](https://material.io/guidelines/style/color.html#color-color-palette) within Ignition GUI, so 3rd party applications can easily choose among these colors if they want to. We could choose one of those more standard colors for now, and move the orange to `gazebo_experimental` so Ignition GUI is more neutral. (3rd party applications can override the style, see pull request #17). I see the red introduced in this PR follows the red palette, so we could start with that. I just wanted to make sure what was the general motivation for the pull request.
